Member Typedef Documentation

typedef std::map<char*, InstancePtr> InstanceTracker::InstanceContainer
 

This maps the pointer to a block of memory to the Instance that holds the block.

typedef std::map<long, long> InstanceTracker::InstanceIDs
 

This allows us to keep track of the next instance identifer for each type of instance we have. The first element tells us the instance type, and the second represents the next instance number for that type.

typedef CountedPtr<Instance> InstanceTracker::InstancePtr

static char* InstanceTracker::createInstance (  long  typeID,
int  size,
int  numToAllocate,
bool  isPersistent,
long  instanceNumber
)  [static, private]
 

This routine will create an Instance, and if it's marked as persistent, it will put it in our instance container.

returns A pointer to the block of memory that was allocated inside the instance.

Mark the specified instance as deleted in the InstanceContainer.

static void* InstanceTracker::findInstance (  void *  ptr,
mc_dbms_typespec *  ts,
int  offset = -1
)  [static]
 

Look through the instances and find one that the given pointer is contained in.

Parameters:
ptr We are trying to find the Instance object that this parameter is a part of.
ts The type of the item we are looking for (this allows us to find the object quicker.
offset The offset of the given pointer from the beginning of the class. This value is obtained using the offsetof() method from stddef.h. A value of -1 is supplied if no offset is available. When this happens, the search is linear within the given types instance map.
Returns:
A pointer to the object that the given ptr is a part of.

static InstancePtr InstanceTracker::findInstanceClass (  char *  ptr,
mc_dbms_typespec *  ts
)  [static]
 

Look through the instances, and return the instance for which the pointer is the same as the data pointer contained in it.

Parameters:
ptr We are trying to find the Instance object that this parameter is a part of.
ts The type of the item we are looking for (this allows us to find the object quicker.
Returns:
A pointer to the instance that the given ptr is in.

static int InstanceTracker::instanceCount (  mc_dbms_typespec *  ts = 0  )  [static, private]
 

This returns a count of the number of instances being tracked. If a typespec is specifed then the count for that type is returned, otherwise this function returns the count for of types.

static void InstanceTracker::purge (   )  [static, private]
 

Remove all data

static void InstanceTracker::report (  bool  cleanShutdown = true  )  [static]
 

This generates a report on the instances contained in this tracker. There will be 2 files created by this routine in the current working directory. the file names are: gen_stats_persistent.txt and gen_stats_transient.txt. If files of this name already exist on disk they will be deleted.

Parameters:
cleanShutdown This is true if we are about to commit the data to the persistent store (there were no errors). It is false if we are not going to commit the data because an error was encountered.
Returns:
A reference to a stringstream object containing the report.

Member Data Documentation

InstanceIDs InstanceTracker::m_instanceIDs [static, private]
 

This is a map key-ed by instance type where the next instance ID for the specified type is kept.

InstanceContainer InstanceTracker::m_instances [static, private]
 

This is a multi-map key by instance type, where all instance data is held.
